name: Hyatt Regency Wichita

reviews.text: Beautiful city riverview location, upscale accomodations
reviews.title: very nice stay

reviews.text: I stayed two nights at the Hyatt Regency Wichita and was very impressed with every aspect of my stay. The grounds were impressive and well-groomed. The lobby was immaculate. I stayed in a king room and was very pleased with the room. The bed was very comfortable and the room was enjoyable. The walls were a bit thin, however. The food was fairly expensive, but what I tried was good. The highlight of my stay was the willingness of the shuttle drivers to transport me to my required locations at varying times; they were very helpful and courteous at all times. Upon my arrival, I called the front desk to ask if there was a fee for a refrigerator to be delivered to the room and, when I was informed it was $10 a night, I declined and decided to "do without". However, after my inquiry phone call, I was charged $10 both nights for a refrigerator that I never ordered (I found this as I checked my electronic folio on the TV system). Both charges were immediately removed following a call to the front desk. All employees I encountered were professional and efficient. Overall, I would highly recommend this property and will definitely stay there again if another visit to Wichita arises.
reviews.title: Very impressed -- Enjoyable stay

reviews.text: The Hyatt Regency in Wichita met the expectations I have regarding Hyatt hotels. The building was beautiful and elegantly decorated and had the amazing beds that all Hyatts have. The location was convenient, but there was a lot of construction going on in front of and around the hotel; apparently they're trying to update the area by adding shopping and restaurants nearby. When this is completed, I'm sure it will great but right now it's an inconvenience and makes it a little bit difficult to get the hotel.
reviews.title: Good hotel - better when they finish it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was helpful and I enjoyed my stay. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Some good, some bad

likes.liked: — Price (we got a very good deal)

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hyatt over a weekend in June. I would recommend this hotel if you need to be downtown or are attending an event at the conference center - it is right next door. If you are going to old town, there are hotels that are better located. The hotel is perfectly acceptable, but not great. On the good side, the rooms are nicely decorated and spacious enough (not giant, but not tiny), the bed was very comfortable, and the hotel itself is very pretty. It is well kept, not run-down or dated at all. It has nice dining choices, and the staff was teriffic - pleasant and helpful. On the bad side, the walls are thinner than the average hotel - we heard basically everything that was said in the room next to ours and out in the hallway. Also, if someone is using the bathroom above you it is very loud, especially the shower. The gym is next to the indoor pool, and it is a nice gym, but the chlorine is overporwering - my eyes were burning all day after I worked out. Finally, it is a minor thing, but is it really necessary to charge guests for parking, especially on the weekend?
reviews.title: Good for a Meeting

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hyatt in early June 07 for a couple days of meetings with some play time here and there. Nice hotel and lobby.
reviews.title: Nice hotel!
Beautiful Downtown Hotel
reviews.text: Getting There: from US 54/400 - Kellogg St., you exit at "Central Business District", which takes you down from the flyover freeway to 3 streets, the farthest West is Main St., where you need to go north. There is street construction being done as you near the hotel, but if you slow down and pay attention, you get through it all right and everything opens up as you reach the hotel. Note that the parking garage is the first thing you come to -- you can either go on in, or continue west to the lobby entrance, get your bags inside, and return to park. It's a bit of a walk back to the lobby from the garage. I was told we would have to pay a fee to park, but everytime I left the gate was up and nobody was in the booth. Freebie!

reviews.title: A nice stay in Wichita
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Wichita for 3 nights in September 2008. Great hotel. Quiet. Professional.

reviews.title: Great hotel; horrible service
reviews.text: But, there were a few quirks.

reviews.title: Great place to stay
reviews.text: Our business meeting was held in another wing of the complex,

reviews.title: Great hotel, friendly staff
reviews.text: almost 2 blocks away. No running back to the room during breaks at the seminar.

reviews.title: Loved the Hyatt
reviews.text: While the view overlooking the river was beautiful, the downtown is a neighborhood in transition. It seems safe, but empty.

reviews.title: Great fun!
reviews.text: the Hyatt was a great idea! Our cousin was in from Denver and we decided to take her out for the night and it was great fun. Awesome river view and great room service!

reviews.title: Offer of Special Deal
reviews.text: I booked a room at the Wichita Hyatt back in May for the 4th of July 2004. The hotel later offered a special 4th of July deal, but did not come back and offer it to me since I was already booked and pre-paid. I asked about this at the desk and was told there were deals still left and that the manager would be alerted and would call my room later. The manager never called, so I went back to the desk and found the manager, Gabe. He then tells me that no one contacted him and there were no deals left. I felt as though I had been cheated and lied to.

reviews.title: My wedding bliss
reviews.text: My fiance and I decided to marry on Poipu Beach, Kauai, Hawaii, at The Hyatt Poipu. Every detail of my wedding went as smooth as silk, thanks to the most wonderful Hyatt wedding planner, her staff, and their attention to every last detail . .Quite possibly the world's finest service , polite, friendly, and always going the extra mile with a smile and dose of hawaiian charm that remainswith you long after you have left the island. To anyone who is considering a wedding in hawaii, a beautiful, pampered honeymoon (Anara Spa OOOHHHHH!!!!)

reviews.title: Hyatt Hotel Ruined Our Weekend
reviews.text: My daughter was accepted into the KCDA Children's Honor Choir and was

This is an average hotel. The rooms and beds are nice, but lack in other areas (the windows don't open, the AC could've been stronger/colder). The elevator makes you get a key out in order to punch in a floor number. While this is a nice feature and sends the illusion you are "safe" staying there, it's really not needed and became annoying. The front desk had great service but the management needs to manage their staff better. I was told the restaurant served food until midnight, sometimes later.
reviews.title: Decent... But...

reviews.text: When I arrived at 9:30, with a group of seven or eight, I was told the kitchen would be closing at 10pm. We asked the bartenders when they close the bar. They said 1:30am. But at 11:45 or so, they announced "last call" and were closing up. I overheard one of them say they were going "out" and were meeting friends at a bar downtown. How rude!
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: Perhaps this is the way the hotel manager likes to run things, but I should think that guests come first. And if the restaurant is supposed to serve food until midnight, or if the bar is supposed to be open until 1:30am -- that's how it should be!
reviews.title: Very Poor Service

reviews.text: It just seemed to me that in this rural town, which pretends to be a city, that people have no idea what service is. So it may not be their fault. But Hyatt, on the other hand, should know better.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in Wichita

reviews.text: Very nice hotel. It was conveniently hooked to convention center. It is located next to the river with a wonderful riverwalk next to it. The pool was small, but our room was very nice and clean. I would stay here again!
reviews.title: Great Service, Restaurant could use some work
Great service
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hyatt in Wichita on Oct 13, 2005. The service was great and eveyone I came in contact with had a smile for me. The hotel is very nice and has a great workout area and pool. The food from room service was wonderful and I will stay there when ever I come to Wichita!

My fiance are so excited that we are finally getting married. We were checking out some reception sites, and decided to look into the Hyatt as it seemed like a very tasteful site. The decor was beautiful, and the wedding coordinator/catering manager seemed very pleasent and helpful. We met with her and toured the hotel. We discussed the details of our reception and told her that we would indeed like to have our reception there. She knew our date, and told us that we would just need to sign the contract and make a deposit. She said that she would need to have some time to prepare the paperwork, but that we could definately have our reception there. We told her that as soon as she had the paperwork ready we would sign and pay the deposit. Three weeks passed, and every time I called her she said that she did not have the papers ready, but that she would email them to me. She never did. Finally, when my fiance called her she told him that some company had called them over the weekend and wanted to book a convention for that day. Because of this, we could not have our recpetion there despite the fact that she had already promised us the space. We wasted three weeks with the Hyatt, and they did nothing but mislead us. She said that we could be put on a "backup list" in case the company did not come through, but that this "wouldn't really be fair to us". This flabergasted us, it was as if she thought canceling our recpetion plans was fair to us. She made it clear that since the Hyatt is a "convetion" center that this is their number one priority. So if you are planning on staying here as a guest, just know that you are not their number one priority unless you are with a convention. And whatever you do, do not have your wedding or reception here.
reviews.title: Don't have a reception here!
Did not like this hotel
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel while on a business trip recently. When I checked in my room looked as if it were only half cleaned. The sheets were dirty and looked as if they had not been changed. The food and service did not meet my expectations. I was very disappointed and will not stay at the Hyatt in Wichita again.

reviews.title: Surprising quality in a small town
reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised to find the high level of quality in a hotel located in Wichita. The staff consistently offered their assistance with a smile and made my family and I feel welcome.

reviews.title: Hyatt Regency Wichita
reviews.text: Wow! This is a gorgeous hotel! The lobby and meeting facilities are stunning and the rooms are equally as beautiful. We were on the 10th floor overlooking downtown and had a great view. Wichita really has an attractive little skyline(especially with landmark buildings illuminated various colors!) and the rooms are situated to take advantage of the scenery. Even the grounds surronding the hotel and the adjoining Century II center are impeccably landscaped. The 400 foot-wide waterfall at the base of the hotel near the river is just too cool.

description: Overlooking the scenic Arkansas River and vibrant cityscape, the hotel is a state of the art facility, that blends natural beauty and elegant style with function to create an unsurpassed environment. Spectacular entry way overlooking the Riverwalk and a one of a kind water wall.
